title: National Centre for e-Social Science Continuation Funding
abstractText:
The objective of the National Centre for e-Social Science (NCeSS) is to enable social scientists to make best use of emerging e-science technologies in order to address the key challenges in their research fields in new ways.

E-Science refers to the growing use of advanced distributed computing infrastructure (the ‘Grid’) to support scientific research. The Grid is shorthand for the emerging technical standards and tools being developed to facilitate collaboration and simplify the sharing of data resources and analysis routines. NCeSS was created in 2004 to promote e-social science – the use of the Grid to benefit the social sciences. NCeSS has a distributed structure, comprising a coordinating Hub at the University of Manchester and a network of research Nodes and small grant projects in universities across the UK. The Hub co-ordinates NCeSS research activities, providing the intelligence, planning and organisation necessary to give strategic direction to the UK's e-social science programme, as well as providing training, technical support, information services and support to users. It acts as the central resource for e-social science issues and activities in the UK, integrating them with ESRC research methods initiatives and the wider UK e-Science Core Programme, and liaising with parallel initiatives overseas.
